sentences.sContent: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.sCn: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

sentences.sContent: ...some people claim that it is a common phenomenon that youngsters spend too much time reading on social networking websites...
...a phenomenon identified by researcher Manu Kapur...
...The study suggests the phenomenon is more isolated than media reports suggest: in fact...
...The reason behind this phenomenon is common — the enormous pressure of finding a job...

remMethod.val: “费脑迷呢” → 他费脑筋琢磨这奇特现象仍迷惑不解 → 现象

words.tran: 现象的；显著的；异常的；能知觉的
现象上地；明白地；从感官认识到

trans.tranOther: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand
